block.p: DEAR DIARY:
A conversation overheard at the West Coast Video in Lawrence Township between two beefy, tattoed men who were draped in chains:
DEAR DIARY:
A conversation overheard at the West Coast Video in Lawrence Township between two beefy, tattoed men who were draped in chains:
First man: ''Man, I can't believe that 'American Beauty' beat out 'The Sixth Sense' for best picture last year.''
Second Man: ''Yeah. 'American Beauty' was just so . . . so . . . common.''
ALISON ROTH
REVERE REVISITED
Listen, my children, and you shall hear
The revisionist ride of Paul Revere
Who, in this apocryphal tale, rides south
Through Marlboro Township, hand cupped to mouth,
Shouting, ''One if by land and two if by sea,''
Till he's stopped in his tracks, changing history.
''Whoa!'' shouts the sheriff. ''When you cupped your hand
It left the reins, which is clearly banned.''
The British arrived, unopposed, by sail
While Paul spent the night in the township jail.
BOB McKENTY
I had this coversation with a 6-year-old in a Hoboken park one recent Sunday morning:
Me: ''Hi, where are your parents?''
Child: ''They're home. I'm with my babysitter.''
Me (understandingly): ''Oh, they're home resting?''
Child: ''No, they're watching TV.''
Me: ''Really?''
Child: ''Yes, they want to know if the Stocking Change is up or the Stocking Change is down.''
MARIKO LOCKHART

While running on the towpath of the Delaware-Raritan Canal, I noticed the spray-painted graffiti on the concrete supports for Interstate 287. There were many tags in the illegibly cryptographic contemporary style, but also a couple in the style of the old masters of New York like ''Taki 183,'' whose tag was derived from his nickname plus the number of the street where he lived.
But these graffiti had a New Jersey twist: ''E-Love Exit 9'' and ''DW Exit 1.''
NANCY FRYER CROFT
PROSTRATE FROM MY PROSTATE
From slumber's soft enfolding arms
From dreams like myrhh and warmth so sweet
Nightly do I abruptly leap
My sacred rendezvous to keep
The enfant terrible around my bladder
Has no remorse my sleep to shatter
This 3 a.m. tyrant fills me with hate
As I stumble to urinate.
PAUL LEWINTER, M.D.

Our new stock girl, Natalie, fielded a call from a customer with her usual verve. When she reported that the woman was coming in to look at a gown for a ''bird mitzvah,'' she received a detailed explanation of the difference between a bar mitzvah and a bat mitzvah and was assured that there was no such thing as a bird mitzvah. And despite some ridicule, Natalie held her ground.
Two days later, a stunning blonde came in for the red gown, and explained that the ''bird mitzvah'' was for an African gray parrot, hence the the red and grey dress code.
SALLIE K. LITCHFIELD
